title: Masters of Earth
author: Cavan Scott & Mark Wright
filename: 193 - Masters of Earth - Cavan Scott & Mark Wright_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
1: INT. VILLAGE HALL
MURMURING OF GATHERED VILLAGERS. CHAIRS SCRAPE ON WOOD.
(SHOUTING) Pipe down! I said, pipe down, the lot of you!
GAVEL REPEATEDLY.
(SHOUTING) Oi!
SUBSIDE.
Better. Let’s get on with it. Laughlin village council now in session, magistrate Alan Weir presiding. Bring him in!
DOOR AT BACK OPENS. ALAN LED ACROSS CREAKING FLOORBOARDS, 2 x
HOLDING HIS ARMS.
(SCARED) Alan, please... I’m beggin’ you —
When I’m in this chair the defendant will address me as Your Honour! — That understood?
Please! I didn’t mean to do it!

They all say that. (READING) “On the morning of 22 August, Ross Nicolson was discovered in the residence of Kyle Inskip, purloining items of rationed foodstuffs. When Mr Inskip asked him to leave, he threatened physical violence.”
MURMURS.
Thieving from a defenceless old man? Fancy yourself as one of
these outlaws, do you? Like that Brody lass?
At least she’s doing something to fight back!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 3
That’s enough! — You got anything to say in your defence?
I.. I was hungry.
We’re all hungry, pal!
SHOUTS OF “AYE!”
You know what we do with neds like you? We’ve got our own law
in this village!
SHOUTS OF “GUILTY!” — BECOMING A CHANT
(OVER NOISE) I wasn’t thinking straight!
DOOR AT BACK OPENS. KYLE HURRIES FORWARD.
What in heaven’s name is wrong with you all? (ALOUD) Enough!
CONTINUES.
(RUSHING TO BENCH) Och, gimme that!
BANGED ON TABLE AGAIN AND AGAIN.
I said, that’s enough!
SUBSIDES.
Kyle, what d’you think you’re doing?
Getting you t’see sense!
Show some respect, I’m the Justice of [the Peace]
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 4
You’re a self-appointed numpty. Now leave that laddie be!
Mr Inskip. I didn’t mean to, I’m so sorry!
I know you are, lad.
You’re the man he stole from, Kyle! Don’t you want to see him punished?
He’s just a wean, I knew his ma.
Yes, and she’d hate to see what he’s become!
I’ve known you a long time too, Alan. You were a good ghillie,
but that doesn’t give you the right to stand in judgment.
Somebody has to!
Then you’re no better than them. We’ve lost enough this last
ten years. Let’s keep hold of some values, eh?
(ANGRY) Just what is it you think I’m trying to do?
BANGS FOR SILENCE.
Court finds the defendant guilty!
CHEER, CHANT “GUILTY!” THROUGH:
Punishment to be carried out immediately!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 5
2. EXT HEATH.
MATERIALISES. QUICK CROSS-FADE TO...
3: INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
CHIME.
Ah! This is it, Peri. That momentary fizz of expectation before the unknown and uncertain become immutable fact.
You’re saying we’ve landed?
Er. Yes.
Then why don’t you just say so? — Where are we, anyway?
BEEP.
Earth... Western hemisphere. Ah! Scotland. Not far from Inverness.
OPENS.
Looks... bleak.
Bonny Scotland. “Fair flower the gowans in our glens,/ The heather on our mountains;/
The blue-bells deck our wizard dens...”
Very poetic.
You know me, Peri, [always-]
A SHUDDER. CONTROL ROOM SHIFTS.
Now what?
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 6
BEEPS.
It seems the ground beneath us is a little on the boggy side.
We're sinking?
I wouldn’t go that far...
SHUDDERS.
Yes. We’re sinking. (BEEPS) I’d better relocate us to somewhere
[a little more —]
Wait, wait! What’s that? — On the scanner!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 7
4: EXT. HEATH
MOB OF JEERING VILLAGERS SHOVE ROSS ACROSS THE HEATH: “GUILTY!”
(SHOUTING) Move it!
(SOBBING) I’m sorry... I’m sorry!
Quit your greetin’!
FOLLOWS, OUT OF BREATH.
Stop this. We’re no’ savages!
Please!
UP ON THE SHOUTING MOB.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright
INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
HEARD VIA SCANNER.
What are they doing to that guy?
Looks like a lynch mob.
(VIA SCANNER, FAINT CHANTING) Stone him!
(DISBELIEVING) No, going to stone him!
They can’t be.
I’m going out there.
OPEN. PERI RUNS
Peri, wait..! Peri —
SHIFTS AGAIN.
Oh, what’s the use?
HE FOLLOWS. CONTINUES
I think they’re going to
OUT.
INTO:
003 NB
Page 8
— I think they’re
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 9
6: EXT. HEATH [CONTINUOUS]
MOB A LITTLE WAY OFF. POLICE BOX LISTS, BOG SQUELCHING AS THE
JUMPS OUT.
Ugh! This stuff is positively glutinous —
Never mind that! Come on! We’ve got to stop them! (SQUELCHES
Peri! (FOLLOWING) Please, be careful!
CROSS TO — A LITTLE FURTHER AWAY:
SHOUTING: “THIEVING SCUMBAG!”; “TEACH HIM A LESSON!”
Teach you to steal food!
Let him be, Alan.
I won’t do it again, I promise!
Damn right you won’t. Let’s get it over with. (TO VILLAGERS) One stone each. You all know what to do.
SCRABBLING FOR STONES.
“STONE HIM! STONE HIM!”
Please — you mustn’t — (GASPS AS THE FIRST STONE HITS HIM) Please — (ANOTHER HITS)
(RUNNING UP) Stop that! Stop that right now!
Who the devil-?
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 10
(FOLLOWING, PLACING HIMSELF BEFORE ROSS) You heard the lady!
Out the way, stranger, or you’ll get the same.
If you want to throw stones, throw them elsewhere!
I give the orders round here!
I don’t think so!
Peri, see if he’s all right. — (TO ALAN) You, sir! Did you give the order to stone this boy?
I did, aye!
Then explain this barbarism, if you can!
I don’t have to! Here, I am the law! I’m keeping the peace!
“The Law”. You’re jist a common thug!
You can shut it and all, Kyle Inskip!
(TO ROSS) Are you okay?
(WINCING) Aye, miss, I’11l be alright...
That’s a nasty cut, we need to get that looked at.
(TO ALAN) “The Law”, you say. What law did this unfortunate break, to justify such punishment?
Stealing food.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 11
I’m not surprised. Just look at him, he’s starving!
We all are!
(LOOKING AROUND) Well — that’s as maybe, but this is the twentieth century, you can’t go around stoning people for theft!
The boy has to pay the price!
“Twentieth century”? Did your watch stop, lass?
W-what do you mean?
Wait. What year is it?
2163. Now — are you going to shift yourself, stranger, or do we stone you too?
Twenty-one... Oh no.
You had your warning.
Peri, we have to leave.
What?
I said, we have to leave. Right this instant!
We can’t just leave this guy —
Once we’re back in the TARDIS I’1l explain everything. But [for now- ]
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 12
THRUSTERS IN THE SKY OVERHEAD. THE CROWD GASP AND SHOUT.
(SHOUTING) It’s a patrol!
Is that some kind of — flying saucer?
Yes. I strongly suggest we make ourselves scarce.
If you run, you’re as good as dead.
Doctor, tell me what’s going on!
8: EXT. SKY ABOVE HEATH
POV. SHUTTLE RETROS FIRE. SAUCER COMING IN TO LAND,
CLAWS EMERGING WITH A WHINE. CROSS TO:
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 13
SC.9. EXT. HEATH
FADE TO NOTHING.
Everybody, keep together!
Ross — stay by me, lad.
OPENS WITH HYDRAULIC HISS, RAMP EXTENDING.
Doctor. What’s going on? Who’s in the saucer?
Oh, Peri. I did try to warn you.
4 x ROBOMEN STOMP DOWN RAMP.
Those headpieces. Are they... Cybermen? Some sort of Cybermen!
Not Cybermen. (BEAT) Robomen. And they’re the least of our
worries.
#1: (TO STOP) Humans will form a line and wait for instructions.
MURMUR IN FEAR, MOVING INTO A LINE.
I don’t understand.
#1: Silence!
SHOVES PERI FORWARD.
Ow!
#1: Humans will form a line!
Just do as he says, Peri.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 14
What did you mean, anyway — “the least of our worries”?
(OFF, AT TOP OF RAMP) Attention, Earthlings!
GLIDES DOWN RAMP.
It can’t be —
I’m afraid it is.
We require more workers at the oil refinery. Obedience will be rewarded. You will be given shelter and sustenance. Volunteers take one pace forward.
BEAT
Forward! Or you will be taken by force.
(SOTTO) Refinery work, eh? Sounds like a job for a thief!
SHOVES ROSS FORWARD
(SHOVED) What? — No, please!
GASPS, SQUELCHING ONTO GROUND.
You can’t just hand him over to those creatures!
Survival of the fittest, lass.
Peri, we can’t get involved.
Haven’t you noticed? We already are! (GOES TO ROSS)
(HISSED) Peri. Peri!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 15
Here, take my hand.
(GETTING UP) I. I... thank you.
Refinery’s the best place for that little runt.
I’ve heard more than enough from you.
This female has also volunteered.
What? No!
There, that’1ll teach you. Stickin’ your nose in other folks’ business!
This male will be the last volunteer.
Who, me? You can’t mean —
That’1ll teach you.
These three humans have been selected. Robomen — bring them!
3 x ROBOMEN GRAB PERI, ALAN AND ROSS.
#1: You will come with us.
You don’t understand. I’m the head man round here! I’m the boss!
Get off! — Doctor! Doctor, help us!
Secure them and prepare for lift off.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 16
AS PERI, ALAN AND ROSS ARE MARCHED UP RAMP:
(STEPPING FORWARD) That’s
BEAT. MENACING WHIRR.
Who was that? Who spoke?
I did!
(HISSED) You fool, you’re
(SOTTO) Please, Mr Inskip. exactly what to expect.
Is that so? Well, you won’
far enough, Dalek!
only gonna get yourself killed!
I know these Daleks of old, I know
t be expectin’ this-!
CRACK! DOCTOR KNOCKED UNCONSCIOUS. HARD CUT TO:
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 17
10: EXT. HEATH (FEW MINUTES LATER
WAKES WITH INTAKE OF BREATH.
Peri!
She’s not here.
THEY’RE ALONE.
What? (REALISATION) The Daleks. The shuttle. They’ve gone!
Aye, back to the refinery. Here, let me help you up.
(GETTING UP) No thank you. I don’t need any more of your kind of help — How long was I out?
Couple a minutes. Only took the three of them, must have had a full quota.
(SIGH) You know, Mr Inskip, if you hadn’t taken it upon yourself to lamp me on the jaw, I [could have —]
Stopped them? You reckon? And how would you have done that, exactly — bein’ deid, and all?
Hmmm... Perhaps. No sense in recriminations, I suppose. — This refinery, where is it exactly?
About fifteen mile across country, that way. — Don’t say you’re thinking of goin’ there!
I need to get my young friend out of there.
Aye, well, good luck with that. You’1ll be needin’ it.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 18
I have my means. (TURNING) Well. Goodbye then, Mr Inskip. (FOLLOW HIM A COUPLE OF STEPS AWAY) Sorry to run out on you, but — (FREEZES)
BUBBLING, SQUELCHING SHORT DISTANCE AWAY.
(CALLING) I told you, refinery’s that way. North and east!
(TARDIS HAS GONE) My TARDIS! Where— ?
(COMING OVER) Problem?
That’s one way of putting it. (TO HIMSELF) Sunk right into the bog, old girl.
Who the devil are you talkin’ to now?
(RESIGNED) Nobody, Mr Inskip. Nobody.
PLOP FROM BOG.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 19
11: INT. DALEK SHUTTLE — HOLDING BAY
HUM. ENGINES IN FLIGHT.
3 x ROBOMEN MARCH PERI, ALAN AND ROSS IN. DALEK GLIDES BEHIND.
Move.
Aow! — Mind out, Boris Karloff. You’re breaking my wrist!
Secure them with the other slave workers.
x 3 MARCHED TO SQUARED PILLAR.
S-slaves?
That’1ll be us, hen. Och, don’t say you volunteered-!
x 3 SLAMMED AGAINST 3 x SIDES OF PILLAR. MOIRA IS SECURED TO THE FOURTH.
Oof! — Not exactly.
Fresh meat for the grinder, that’s all we are. Still — the more the merrier, I suppose.
Speak for yourself.
Slave workers will be silent! — (TO ROBOMEN) Activate neck restraints.
HUM OF NECK RESTRAINTS EMERGING FROM WALL. CLICKING INTO PLACE. PERI, ALAN, ROSS ALL GASP, SLIGHTLY CHOKED.
#1: Neck restraints in position.
Trying to choke us?
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 20
Way I heard it, these things used to have sharp edges. That’s until the Daleks realised their ‘volunteers’ were cuttin’ their own throats on ‘em, rather than endure another day’s hard labour.
Great.
Remain silent! — Robomen, return to your duties.
#1: We obey.
DALEK AND 3 x ROBOMEN LEAVE, DOORS SLIDING SHUT BEHIND.
(CALLING AFTER) What, are just going to leave us here?
This is all your fault, woman. You and your idiot friend, sticking your noses in!
Oh, grow up. — Ross? You OK round there?
(NOT OK) I’m fine...
Funny, that — he sounds scared half to death.
You can shut it, and all!
Just makin’ conversation. The rest of them here don’t talk much. Apart from sayin’ their prayers. I’m Moira, by the way.
Hi, I’m Peri. (LAUGHS)
Something funny?
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 21
Introducing myself like I’m at a party.
Keep hold of that. Keeps us human. — You’re American!
Keep it up, ladies. Och, this is scintillatin’ stuff!
(TO MOIRA) I’m a.. traveller, I suppose.
(CONTEMPT) A tourist!
And you were stuck here when the Daleks came?
No, me and the Doctor only just arr—[ived] (STOPS SELF) Oh, it doesn’t matter. — What are they doing here, do you know?
In Scotland? Guess it’s the oil, hen. It always is.
No, no, I mean — what are they doing here on Earth? (MORE TO SELF) They look kind of different...
What do?
The Daleks.
Different to what?
The Daleks on Necros. I don’t know, they seem more primitive, somehow. And what’s with the satellite dishes on their backs? I’m guessing it isn’t to get the sports channels.
They’re just Daleks.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 22
Hold on. (REALISATION; TO PERI) “What are the Daleks doing here on Earth?” — that’s what you said. What did you mean, “here on Earth”?
Look, I said it doesn’t matter. But trust me, me and the Daleks go way back...
What, to another planet?
Like in space?
Yep. Like in space.
(SNORTS) Ha!
How’s that even possible?
Long story.
We’re not going anywhere, are we [now?]
CHANGE PITCH, BEGINNING DESCENT. TANNOY HISSES INTO LIFE.
(TANNOY DISTORT) Sixty rels to landing. Prepare to disembark slave workers.
Guess we’re at the refinery already.
Moira? Have you been in there? Do you know what it’s like?
No, son. There’s no-one been in has ever come out. — Well, not unless they’ve been made into a Roboman, of course...
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 23
12: EXT. INSKIP HOME
2 X FOOTSTEPS APPROACH, STOPPING ON DRIVEWAY.
My, that’s a fine looking motorbike propped up in your drive, Mr Inskip.
Aye, my pride and joy. Do you ride?
I’ve been known to, in my youth. (BEAT) The Daleks let you come and go in the village as you please?
Pretty much. Lived in Laughlin all my life. Some of the lassies do laundry. I’m a mechanic by trade, fix up vehicles for ‘em. (WALKING TO DOOR; SLIGHTLY OFF) Do as we’re told, they leave us alone.
For now.
UNLOCKS FRONT DOOR.
Mebbe. — Straight up the lane, then, and north and east at the reservoir.
Um, you may be able to help me, Mr Inskip.
I thought you didn’t need my kind of help?
Yes, well — my, ah, transport is currently off the road.
Oh, and you want me to look at it...?
Most kind, but no. I was wondering if you might let me borrow your bike...?
No chance! Only old Kyle gets on that beastie.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 24
I see. (SIGHS, WEARY) Look, may I come in? It’s been a trying morning.
Aye, I suppose.
THEY GO INTO HOUSE. CONTINUES INTO:
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 25
13: INT. INSKIP HOME — HALLWAY/KITCHEN [CONTINUOUS]
SHUT BEHIND. JINGLE AS KYLE DROPS KEYS IN POT BY DOOR. AS
You must keep your ear to the ground in the village. Are there any weaknesses in security at the refinery, that you know of?
Having a laugh, aren’t you?
I’ve never been more serious.
STOPPING IN KITCHEN.
Persistent, I’1ll give you that. (PICKING UP BOTTLE) — A wee dram, for your journey?
Ah, no thank you. But don’t let me stop you.
CLINKS, STOPPER PULLED, MEASURE POURED, THROUGH:
I shan’t force you. It’s me last bottle of the good stuff, this. Once it’s gone... Och, well. Slainte.
DRINKS
Indeed. Slainte. (BEAT) Now, about that refinery...
Well, why would I be knowing anything about that? I fix things, keep my head down, try to survive.
Admirable policy. What are we, ten years into Dalek occupation?
Meteorite bombardments came in... when was it, '52? Then came the sickness. Crosses on doors and 'Bring out your dead.' Daleks rode in six months later, like the Horsemen of the Apocalypse.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 26
Standard Dalek invasion strategy. Weaken, divide, conquer.
There’s resistance. The odd patrol brought down. Nothing to make any difference.
You'd be suprised. (BEAT) The refinery. You must know
something.
Place is tight as a drum. The Daleks are sucking the life out
of the Scotland, stripping the land like-
I know what the Daleks are doing.
Plenty go in. No-one comes out.
We’ll see about that.
You’re on a hiding to nothing, man!
Frequently. But that never seems to stop me. (TURNING) My thanks, Mr Inskip. I shan’t take up any more of your time.
WALKS DOWN HALLWAY.
Suit yourself.
OPENS DOOR.
(CALLING) I’1l see myself out.
Suit yourself!
EXITS, CLOSING DOOR LOUDLY.
(TO HIMSELF) Hiding to nothing. — Still: Slainte.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 27
ENGINE STARTS UP OUTSIDE.
What the-?! My keys!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 28
14: EXT. INSKIP HOME
ENGINE GUNS, ACCELERATING AWAY AS THE HOUSE DOOR OPENS.
Hey! My bike!
ROARS AWAY.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 29
15: EXT. REFINERY
SOUNDS. HEAVY MACHINERY, HISSING PIPES, CLANG OF TOOLS. SHUTTLE RAMP LOWERS, HATCH OPENS.
Move forward!
2 x ROBOMEN MARCH FORWARD AHEAD OF PERI, ALAN, MOIRA, ROSS & 4 x OTHER SLAVES, FOLLOWED BY A DALEK. MOVING ON THROUGH:
This place looks like hell.
You got that right.
The Daleks push the workers to the point of death, because if they die.. well, there are always more to be had.
Sounds like every boss there’s ever been.
What are they doing here? What do they even want?
The Doctor knew to expect them here, on Earth, now. He must
know what they’re up to.
Know a lot about the Daleks, this Doctor of yours?
More than anyone else in the universe, I should [think. ]
(BEHIND) Halt!
STOP.
Robomen will assign slave workers to work details.
#1: We obey.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 30
These four will be held for physical assessment.
Why aren’t we being assigned to a work detail?
SWIVEL.
Do not question the Daleks!
I wouldn’t dream of it.
Move!
SLAVES MOVED AWAY BY ROBOMEN. PERI, ALAN, ROSS AND MOIRA MOVED IN THE OTHER DIRECTION.
You need to learn to keep that geggy shut, little lady.
Like that’1ll ever happen.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 31
16: EXT. REFINERY
A LITTLE DISTANCE FROM REFINERY. MOTORBIKE APPROACHES. ENGINE SPLUTTERS. BIKE COUGHS TO A HALT.
(TO SELF) Ah. Well, I suppose I was lucky there was fuel in the tank to start with.
DISMOUNTS.
Thank you, Mr Inskip, I’1ll be sure to return this transport of delight at the first opportunity.
TAKES A BREATH.
Shanks’s pony it is then, Doctor.
BEGINS TO WALK.
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 32
17: INT. REFINERY — CELL
OUTSIDE, INDUSTRIAL SOUNDS CAN BE HEARD.
Why are they keeping us here? What does “physical assessment” mean?
Be thankful we’re not out there with the others, up to your heid in industrial sludge.
They’1ll be wanting to make sure we're of hardy Scottish stock before they put us to work.
You seem to know a lot about it?
Just a guess. Take a cross-section of your workers, make sure they’re up to it.
You really think the Daleks care about our welfare?
The Daleks may be cruel, but they’re not stupid. Moira’s right.
Thanks. (MOVES TO SIT NEXT TO PERI) So, you and the Doctor came across the Daleks on... Necros, you said?
It’s hard to believe, I know. You see, the Doctor has a ship. A very special ship.
And the Daleks are out there, in space? Conquering other worlds?
They never stop.
And that’s what your Doctor does — fight them?
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 33
Whenever he meets them, yeah.
He was keeping well out of the way back there, in the village.
I know. It’s weird. This time, he seemed... oh, I don’t know.
Scared?
No!
He wasn’t scared to take you on, Alan Weir!
(AMUSED) Oh! Found your backbone, have ye, thief? — Come on, then, wee man, I’1l take you on.
Leave him alone!
I suppose your Doctor will be coming to rescue us all by hisself? Our knight in multi-coloured armour?
I’d like to think so! — Although... we were apart for a long time, until recently. Maybe he’s changed more than I thought.
GETS UP.
Where are you off to, now?
ACROSS THE CELL.
Moira?
BANGS ON METAL DOOR.
You out there! Robomen!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 34
What are you doing?
GETS UP.
I have information!
(LAUGHING) She’s selling you out!
(CROSSING TO MOIRA) Moira? Why are you doing this? Moira!
STRUGGLES WITH MOIRA, TRYING TO WRESTLE HER BACK. MOIRA’S
HAMMERS ON METAL.
You awake out there? I said, I have information!
Moira, please!
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 35
18. EXT. REFINERY.
REFINERY, CLANKING AND HISSING. KLAXON SOUNDS.
Refinery output has fallen by two-point-seven percent. All work details must increase productivity immediately or workers will be punished. Obey your masters!
MOVE TO FENCE, SWISHING THROUGH GRASS.
(TO SELF) ‘Obey your masters’. Some things never change.
PULLS AT FENCE. METALLIC RATTLE.
(TO SELF) Can’t say I much fancy the ten-metre barbed wire
fence. The front door it is, then...
AWAY...
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB)
19: INT. REFINERY — CELL
FIST ON METAL. PERI STRUGGLING WITH MOIRA.
Come on! I have information for you!
Moira, you mustn't!
(LAUGHS IN BACKGROUND) Every man for himself.
RELEASED OUTSIDE.
It’s too late!
Why are you doing this?
GRINDS OPEN.
Get back!
So you can sell us out?
Just do it!
THEY MOVE BACK. ROBOMAN SHUFFLES INTO CELL.
#1: What do you want?
I have something to tell you.
#1: You will report it to me.
Come closer.
SHUFFLES FORWARD.
Page 36
MASTERS OF EARTH by Cavan Scott & Mark Wright (003 NB) Page 37
#1: Report.
Report this, Jimmy!
WITH A GRUNT, MOIRA TACKLES ROBOMAN.
#1: (STRUGGLING) Desist. Workers are forbidden to attack Robomen.
Get his rifle! — Peri!!!
Got it! — Ross, watch the door.
(RESTRAINED. INTO HELMET MIC) Emergency. Emergency. Prisoners escaping.
Are you gonna sit there and watch?
I’m just enjoying the show, hen.
PUSHES PERI ASIDE. SHE GOES DOWN WITH A GASP. RIFLE
AWAY.
Peri!
It’s alright, I’m o— [kay] (GASPS, THROTTLED BY ROBOMAN)
#1: Forbidden... to... attack...!
The rifle, Alan! Get the rifle!
Are you soft in the heid? They’1ll hear!
STRANGLED NOISES

(REMEMBERING) Paul... Brown.

J-Janine.
Janine Brown. You were born in Baltimore, in the United States — and you’ve come so very, very far from home, haven’t you? With me. With —

The Doctor, that’s right. You’re my friend, Peri Brown. You always have been, even when I’ve let you down. I know I’ve let you down before, Peri Brown, but I promise I won’t ever fail you again.
